objects.name: PROJECTOR LIBRA
objects.description:
Among the threat actors distributing Bumblebee is PROJECTOR LIBRA (aka [EXOTIC LILY](https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/exposing-initial-access-broker-ties-conti/)), a criminal group that uses file sharing services to distribute malware after direct email correspondence with a potential victim. PROJECTOR LIBRA has been reported [as an initial access broker with ties to Conti ransomware](https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/exposing-initial-access-broker-ties-conti/). 

[Bumblebee](https://research.nccgroup.com/2022/04/29/adventures-in-the-land-of-bumblebee-a-new-malicious-loader/) malware [replaced BazarLoader sometime in February 2022](https://www.proofpoint.com/us/blog/threat-insight/bumblebee-is-still-transforming). Since then, campaigns that formerly distributed BazarLoader are now distributing Bumblebee instead.

objects.name: Recent Bumblebee malware activity distributed by PROJECTOR LIBRA
objects.description: Recent Bumblebee malware activity distributed through PROJECTOR LIBRA (aka EXOTIC LILY) delivering Cobalt Strike. Information presented here should provide a clearer picture of the group’s tactics and help security professionals better defend their organizations against this threat.
